text: Policy update: assistant may write within .context-memory (user-approved).
User prefs: codex approval-required; logging enabled; refresh enabled.
Added writer-policy.md to document write/log/refresh rules.
Updated AGENTS.md to document .context-memory write policy and logging/refresh behavior.

Enabled chat logging and Recent Chat section in summary.
is it possible to include the chat conversation in the context-memory?
Yes — chat logging is enabled and integrated into the summary. I updated scripts, recorded your question, and I’m now logging this reply so the pair appears together.
can this be automatic so that you dont need to ask me again about saving thing like this in context-memory?
Policy: enable auto chat logging and auto summary refresh for future messages.
Confirmed: auto chat logging and auto summary refresh enabled; I will persist future messages and updates without asking.

is the ff complete text are also stored right now?:What I changed

- Preferences: Set auto_chat_logging=true and auto_refresh_summary=true in .context-memory/live/state.json.
- Policy doc: Updated .context-memory/live/writer-policy.md with an Automation section.
- Journal: Logged your request and the policy change.
- Summary: Refreshed; Recent Chat now shows your message and this confirmation.

Result

- Future user/assistant messages are logged automatically to .context-memory/live/journal.ndjson.
- summary.md updates after notable events without asking.

If you later want to disable this, say “disable auto chat logging” or “disable auto refresh,” and I’ll flip the
flags and log it.
Backfilled 'how context-memory remembers' explainer into live/guides/how-context-memory-works.md.
Added comprehensive Context Memory guide at live/guides/context-memory-overview.md and linked from READMEs.
Copied referenced docs/scripts to live/guides/linkfiles (excluded live log/state files).
Added linkfiles/INDEX.md with descriptions and authoritative source paths.
Output styling policy: Use underlined text for emphasis in CLI outputs; avoid background colors. Docs may use <u> tags sparingly. Preference recorded per user request.
Policy update: Added Clarification & Approval Protocol — always ask on ambiguity, no edits to context-os/ without explicit approval, confirm scope, and log intent/results in journal.
Reviewed RESUME.md and CLAUDE_NATIVE_AGENT_PROPOSAL.md reference; preparing recap + adoption plan proposal.

Audited context-os/CLAUDE_NATIVE_AGENT_RESEARCH.md for readiness: command naming mismatches (/context-execute vs /execute), safety tiers (3-tier vs 4-tier), logging levels (5 vs 4), concurrency cap (5 vs 2), cache TTL not implemented, resource limits not enforced. Preparing correction list + patch preview on approval.

Applied minimal style-only changes to reduce text flicker while dragging: rounded transform offsets and added compositor hints; files: components/canvas/popup-overlay.tsx, components/annotation-canvas-modern.tsx.
Disabled per-frame debug logging in popup overlay (transform_changed, pan_move), removed header backdrop blur, and added paint isolation + font smoothing on canvas container/infinite-canvas.
Disabled .popup-background elements inside transformed overlay to reduce repaint/selection flicker during drag.
Added selection guards to prevent text highlighting during drag in popup overlay and canvas; injected global CSS for html.dragging-no-select; clear selection at drag start and restore on end.
Overlay now keeps pointer-events:auto whenever popup layer is active; removed isPointerInside gating to ensure overlay always intercepts mousedown and prevents native selection on repeated re-grips.

Implemented RAF-driven popup dragging to avoid per-move React renders; added transform-on-element during drag and commit-on-end. Guarded original drag effect. Added content-visibility/contain on popup content containers.

Converted popup overlay canvas panning to RAF-driven element transform updates; no per-move React state. Commit final transform on pan end. Added refs for transform/RAF and synced transform on pan start.
dragging with many open popup with larger files work well

Reduced drag-start hitch: avoid setState at t=0 for canvas and popup drags; lowered hysteresis to 2px; immediate first-frame transform write; element-level cursor update; element data-dragging flag for popups; commit state only on end.
both individual and entire cancas dragging work so well
Added LOD: IntersectionObserver to track visible popups and limit connection line generation to visible set. Kept virtualization for large popup lists and RAF-driven panning/dragging.

text: Wired overlay pan state back to AnnotationApp so layout persistence ignores drag-time mutations; fixed prop wiring after runtime error.
Cancelling any in-flight layout save while overlay is panning prevents mid-drag hydrations; PopupOverlay now reports pan start/end to the parent.
Fix follow-up: relocated overlay panning guard inside AnnotationAppContent to avoid top-level return and ensure pending saves cancel when panning toggles.
Moved overlay panning save-cancel hook inside AnnotationAppContent to fix build error; ensures debounced saves clear immediately when panning starts.
Fixed stray useEffect after export function; pan-state save cancellation now scoped inside AnnotationAppContent without breaking build.

Patched popup overlay hook order: moved child-row renderer useMemo after useLayer to fix temporal dead zone (layerCtx before init).
